tool.name: CreateProject

param.name: ProjectFile
param.dialogReference: Select the folder where the project files will be added.

param.name: ProjectName
param.dialogReference: Provide a name for the project. It should not contain spaces of special characters. Try providing a name less than 20 characters.

param.name: ProjectSR
param.dialogReference: A Projected Coordinate System for the project. Output files will be provided with this coordinate system. Recommended Projected Coordinate Systems for the United States are the State Plane Coordinate System or Universal Transverse Mercator zonal systems. Do not use a Geographic Coordinate System (e.g. Latitude and Longitude).

param.name: ProjectBND
param.dialogReference: Provide a project area boundary layer. Use the GreyToGreenData Toolbar to create a polygon layer if one is not available.

tool.summary: Create a new Grey To Green Project for ArcGIS.
tool.usage: This is the first step after collecting data for your project area. The project is created in the specified folder. A new file geodatabase is created, a project file (with the name and extension p), a map document, and an Excel spreadsheet.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Create a new Grey To Green Project for ArcGIS.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Water Institute, University of South Florida. Patel College of Global Sustainability, University of South Florida. Thomas L. Singleton Consulting, Inc. University of Florida Gulf Coast Research and Education Center.
